content.description: Start in a short crack, passing two bolts on 10d climbing.  The 11b crux is just before the third bolt.  From there, easier climbing leads to the anchor.
content.location:
First route left of

Wild Gazongas

.

climbs.name: Wild West
climbs.fa: (TR) Scott Erler, May 1988, (Lead) Darrell Hensel, Kevin Powell and Eric Jackson, 1997

content.description: Fun edging leads past 4 bolts on good rock.  The technical crux is in the vicinity of the second bolt, with another slightly easier crux above the third bolt.
content.protection:
4 bolts. Shares the 2 bolt anchor at the top of

Wild Women

.
content.location:
First route right of

Arpa Carpa

.

climbs.name: Arpa Carpa
climbs.fa: Phil Warrender, Jim Wilson, Tobin Sorenson & Paul Cowen, May 1973

content.description: Climb up a shallow finger crack with slippery feet in a left-facing dihedral and belay at a ledge - 50', (5.10a).  Alternatively climb the corner to the right to the same ledge - (5.9).  Continue up the runout face past one bolt to the top - (5.10a).  You can also bail out right after the 1st pitch to a bolted anchor with rappel slings.
content.location:
Leftmost route on Arpa Carpa Cliff and left of

Wild West

.

climbs.name: Wild Gazongas
climbs.fa: Rick Accomazzo, Richard Harrison & John Long, July 1973

content.description: Start on the twin finger cracks until they peter out.  Continue up and then left to belay on a small ledge at a bolted anchor.  Rappel from slings here (50', you may want to replace the slings) or do the second pitch and move right and continue up the face past 3 bolts.
content.protection: thin to small gear and nuts, 3 bolts
